content.prompt:
​

  • Both graphs are shown in the x y plane. 
  • All coordinates are approximate. 
  • For the graph of the function f, the x axis ranges from negative 4 to 4 in increments of 1. 
  • The y axis ranges from negative 3 to 5 in increments of 1. 
  • Moving from left to right:
  • The curve begins at (negative 4 comma 2) and continues to (negative 2 comma 0) in a straight line. 
  • The curve decreases to reach a low point at (negative 0.5 comma negative 2.2).
  • The curve then increases to cross the y axis at (0 comma negative 2) and then cross the x axis at (1 comma 0).
  • The curve continues to increase and reach the point (2 comma 3), at which the curve transitions to a straight line from (2 comma 3) to (3 comma 4) to (4 comma 5). 
  • For the graph of the function g, the x axis ranges from negative 3 to 5 in increments of 1.
  •  The y axis ranges from negative 3 to 5 in increments of 1.
  •  Moving from left to right:
  • The curve begins at the point (negative 3 comma negative 2).
  • The curve decreases to a low point at (negative 2 comma negative 3).
  • The curve increases to pass through the origin and then through the point (1 comma 2).
  • The curve passes through (2 comma 3) and reaches a high point at (2.5 comma 3.2).
  • The curve decreases to pass through (3 comma 3), crosses the x axis at (4.3 comma 0), and ends at (5 comma negative 2).

 

​The graphs of y=fx{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} and y=gx{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} are given. What is the value of ffg1{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} ?

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
